intro: Ranunculus karkaralensis, commonly known as the Karkaralensis buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, delicate flowers that bloom in early spring. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
